description:
Great Opportunity

What's in it for you?

Eligible for a comprehensive and competitive benefits package including bonus, including: Medical/Vision/Dental/Rx plans, PTO, Holiday Pay, sick pay, matching 401k and More!

Senior Production Manager Details

  • Direct Hire position
  • $ 140,000.00 / annually
  • First Shift ( Monday through Friday )
  • Manage a team of Production Chemists and Technicians for peptide manufacturing and supervise all manufacturing stages which include synthesis, cleavage, purification, reconstitution and lyophilization
  • Supervise in-process analysis in all manufacturing stages and assign tasks for team members and follow up on completion
  • Ensure that written procedures (SOP, BPR) and cGMP guidelines are followed and review and complete cGMP documentation
  • Ensure efficient collaboration between Production department and other supporting departments such as Operations, Logistics, QC, and QA
  • Train Production team members to the required standard of operation and evaluate their performances
  • Adhere to manufacturing schedules and timelines
  • Propose technical and chemical improvements of the manufacturing process
  • Ensure safe, efficient and conscious use of the instruments, raw materials and other resources
  • Ensure manufacturing and personnel safety and security in the workplace
  • Write technical reports and summaries
  • Train new hires in peptide manufacturing

Senior Production Manager Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree in Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering or equivalent field and 5+ years laboratory experience with 8 – 10 years of experience as a production chemist in a cGMP environment
  • Familiar with scientific equipment and utilities including but not limited to production
  • Working experience with cGMP and safety regulations and with cGMP manufacturing and documentation standards
  • Advanced PC knowledge including planning tools
  • Ability to effectively organize, multitask, and work in a fast-paced, deadline driven work environment
  • Ability to communicate in a proactive and solution-focused manner, including keeping management aware of potential issues
  • Detail oriented with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve problems
  • Communicate effectively and ability to function well in a team environment
  • Experience with manufacturing equipment such as reactors for commercial scale (preferred)

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and celebrate diversity at all levels of our organization.
